title: Patriots face a daunting 2026 schedule after winning AFC East
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots The Patriots' title as reigning AFC East champions will lead to a tougher slate of opponents in 2026.
Mike Vrabel, Drake Maye, and the Patriots are facing a tough road in 2026.
(AP Photo/Greg M.

title: Is it worth replacing the catalytic converter in my 25 year old car?
author: John Paul
bullets: How To John Paul, AAA Northeast's Car Doctor, hears from a reader whose 2000 Buick has a catalytic converter with a hole in it.
The Car Doctor hears from a reader whose 2000 Buick has a catalytic converter with a hole in it.
AP Photo/Alan Diaz By John Paul December 30, 2025 4 minutes to read Q.

title: Hundreds of flights delayed, canceled at Logan amid forceful winds
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Local News Seventy flights, 65 through local airliner CapeAir, arriving and leaving Logan Airport were canceled.
FILE — Delta Air Lines jets on the tarmac at Boston Logan Airport in Boston in 2023.

Vanessa Leroy/The New York Times By Molly Farrar December 30, 2025 | 6:29 PM 1 minute to read As strong winds gust into Boston on Tuesday, hundreds of flights in and out of Logan Airport are facing delays and cancellations.

title: Brown University to install more cameras, boost campus security following deadly shooting
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Education Brown will install additional security cameras at the academic building where a gunman killed two students and injured nine others earlier this month.
The American flag flew at half-staff on the main green of Brown University in Providence, in the aftermath of the shooting in which two students were killed and nine others were wounded.
Mark Stockwell for the Boston Globe By Abby Patkin December 30, 2025 | 3:27 PM 2 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Black Mountain has fixed one of two broken chairlifts
author: Kristi Palma
bullets: Skiing Mountain officials worked "around the clock" to get the double chairlift running.
Black Mountain in Jackson, N.
H.

title: New Mass. Dunkin’ facility’s doughnut aroma is overwhelming neighbors
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Local News A Haverhill resident’s complaint of it smelling "like doughnuts all the time” set off a wave of online comments.
Donuts are displayed for sale inside a Dunkin' Donuts.

Luke Sharrett, Bloomberg A massive new doughnut plant producing about a million pastries a day is drawing complaints in Haverhill, where residents say an overpowering doughnut smell has been drifting into their homes for weeks.

title: Methuen man charged with murdering his mother, a Lawrence teacher
author: Abby Patkin
bullets: Crime A relative of Dominga Romano’s told Telemundo they hadn’t heard from her since Christmas morning, prompting a welfare check and subsequent 911 call Monday.

By Abby Patkin December 30, 2025 | 2:15 PM 2 minutes to read A Methuen man appeared in court Tuesday after he was accused of murdering his mother, a beloved Spanish teacher who taught at Lawrence High School.
Anthony Nunez-Romano, 26, was ordered held without bail after pleading not guilty to murder and two counts of illegally owning a firearm.

title: Patriots’ Stefon Diggs is facing strangulation, assault charges
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots Diggs has an arraignment scheduled for Jan.
Stefon Diggs.

title: Truck carrying $400K in lobster stolen after it left Taunton facility
author: Beth Treffeisen
bullets: Crime CEO of supply chain company says shipment vanished while en route to Costco stores.
Cooked lobsters sit on ice at Woodman's in Essex.

Erin Clark/Globe Staff A truck carrying more than $400,000 worth of lobster meat vanished somewhere between a Taunton warehouse and its Midwest Costco destinations, according to the Indiana-based freight company responsible for the shipment.

title: NFL experts make case for outside MVP candidate, but admit Drake Maye will ‘probably win it’
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Morning Sports Update "Drake Maye's not the one who put the schedule together.
You put them out there, he knocks them all down.
" Drake Maye during the Patriots win agains the Jets.
